channel.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
channel.description: We all know Paypal is no longer safe(it hasn't been for a long time I know), fear of chargeback is always on my mind no matter how trusted the person is. You see people go on massive scam sprees etc so yeah I was wondering what is a low hassle safe way to receive money then xfer to bank/paypal. I'm not bothered about sending as I buy with my paypal usually just the receiving part. I'd like the methods to be mainstream too, I've probably heard of the ones you'll reccomend but its nice to have someone tell me the reasons why. Ty in advance.

item.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Panhandling.

Read full topic
item.source: Low hastle safe money recieving method

item.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

BloodRayne:

[quote=PayPal TOS]Please note: PayPal’s consumer protection programs only apply to tangible, physical goods which can be shipped, and excludes everything else, including but not limited to: intangibles, services, quasi-cash and all non-tangible, non-physical goods.

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=p/gen/terms-outside

If a charge back is opened against you, quote that and you’ll be fine, most of the time it will work even if they haven’t mentioned virtual goods in the notes.

It’s an entirely different story if the PayPal account was stolen though, in which case the funds will almost always be recovered.[/quote]
Sorry but not wanting to sound stupid but I want to sell virtual goods and they don’t cover that…?

Read full topic
item.source: Low hastle safe money recieving method

item.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Please note: PayPal's consumer protection programs only apply to tangible, physical goods which can be shipped, and [b]excludes everything else[/b], including but not limited to: [b]intangibles, services, quasi-cash and all non-tangible, non-physical goods[/b].

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=p/gen/terms-outside

If a charge back is opened against you, quote that and you’ll be fine, most of the time it will work even if they haven’t mentioned virtual goods in the notes.

It’s an entirely different story if the PayPal account was stolen though, in which case the funds will almost always be recovered.

Read full topic
item.source: Low hastle safe money recieving method

item.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

marcbob:

Send as a gift with a note saying they are buying virtual goods and will not charge back. If they try and get it refunded just call paypal and explain the person is trying to scam you and it was clearly for virtual goods. You’ll win every time.

Ty, I’ll give it a test go.

Read full topic
item.source: Low hastle safe money recieving method

Make them pay as a gift or donation, that way no chargebacks.

They can charge back.
[/quote]Not if sent as gift or donation[/quote]
Yes they can, I’d show you proof but my accounts locked that has the proof on it for not paying the charge back lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:15, topic:435554”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=538276.msg3944818#msg3944818 date=1331763395]

First of all, try getting the PayPal money into your bank account, and THEN giving the person what they donated for. It should only take 24 - 48 hours.

Negative balance…

Please can people answer the question and not suggest anything other than the answer to the question, I know how Paypal works perfectly fine but thats for bringing it up anyways.
[/quote]
Have the person pay someone you trust, then have that person give the money to you.[/quote]
But then what happens if my friend gets chargebacked;o? + I’m very wary of other people financially, anything other than family on the surface I seem like I don’t care but I’m constantly thinking about it >.< + my sister was bitching that paypal say I owe them £60 due to being chargebacked on her card so she’s going to have to cancel it so I don’t have to pay up;o.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:2, topic:435554”]Get the cache cash in person or in the mail, thats the only ‘real’ safe way to do it.

EDIT: Wrong type of cash [/quote]
what if the cache cash is corrupted counterfeit?

item.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

@Stupit, I’m not saying it doesn’t work. I believe you that it works for you but it doesn’t work for me anymore. Remember we live in different parts of the world etc which may be a reason why it doesn’t work i.e. you can’t use paypal with an egyption bank account etc. However I do think tis odd it doesn’t work for me.

Read full topic
item.source: Low hastle safe money recieving method

item.title: Low hastle safe money recieving method
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:7, topic:435554”][quote author=Stupit link=topic=538276.msg3937875#msg3937875 date=1331172088]

@dag, its hard to find them:(. Got chargebacked $50 like an hour ago:(.
Also, I’m going to get back into rsps in a few months just improving my knowledge slowly but gradually atm so I want to accept payments for a donations for donater status and eventually evolve it into a membership system but to do that I need a safe means of accepting cash before I can consider implementing a system like that.

Make them pay into one account and once they’ve paid, send it into another account. Easy.
[/quote]
That’s what I thought till recently:(, for some reason all the accounts I make aren’t limited(apart from the £1000 limit per year etc) but it still says I need to verify it for it work. Not too sure what the problem is and Paypal has the worst customer service I’ve ever seen so I’m not too sure how to get around it. Hopefully it will sort itself out but just incase it doesn’t I’d like to know other methods.[/quote]
It works. Believe me, I’ve done it.

Read full topic
